info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 21 at 7:41PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...A cluster of thunderstorms will impact portions of Isle of Wight and southeastern Surry Counties and the City of Suffolk through 845 PM EDT... At 739 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a cluster of thunderstorms with heavy rain centered near Holland, moving north at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph. Rainfall 1 to 2 inches. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Localized flooding of poor drainage and low lying areas. Locations impacted include... Newport News, Smithfield, Windsor, Downtown Suffolk, Holland, Suffolk, Isle Of Wight, Rescue, Driver, Carrsville, Crittenden, Whaleyville, Kings Fork, Zuni, Rushmere, Pons, Carrollton, Longview, Benns Church and Suffolk Airport. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
